intro: Racosperma cerastes, commonly known as the narrow-leafed wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, which is characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows as a shrub, featuring slender, often twining stems and small, bipinnate leaves. Its yellow flowers are clustered in racemes, and it produces flat, dehiscent pods that release seeds when mature. Racosperma cerastes is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing resilience to drought conditions.
